column1: Isumbras is of French and Old English origin and means "iron-arm". It comes from the French bras meaning "arm"
column2: and the Anglo-Saxon and Middle High German word isen which means "iron".Jim Allan

column1: J.R.R. Tolkien possibly got the name from wikipedia:Sir Isumbras
column2: an English medieval romance about a man who suffers a lifetime of hardship but who finds happiness in his latter years.Harriet Hudson (ed.)
